content.text: Twice as many football players vote blue than vote orange
Complete the bar chart
Write down the mode
40 football players vote on the colour of new shirts
The results for red, yellow and green are shown in the bar chart
Complete the pie chart
Work out the percentage of hockey players who vote grey
40 hockey players vote on the colour of new shirts
The table shows the results
Complete the timetable
Beth walks \(4\mathrm{km}\) from her home to the station at a speed of \(6\mathrm{km / h}\)
She wants to travel on the 09 24 bus
Work out the latest time she can leave her home
45 seats on the bus are occupied
This is \(\frac{3}{5}\) of the total number of seats on the bus
Work out the total number of seats on the bus
Here is part of the timetable for buses from the station to the city centre
All buses take the same time to travel from the station to the city centre
Beth buys \(2.4\mathrm{kg}\) of onions costing \(\$ 1.25\) per kilogram and \(4.5\mathrm{kg}\) of potatoes
The total cost is \(\$ 11.64\)
Find the cost of \(1\mathrm{kg}\) of potatoes
One day 140 people enter a shop
The ratio adults : children = 3 : 2
Find the number of adults who enter the shop
The price of a television in this shop is \(\)624
37.5% of this price is profit
Calculate the profit on this television
The price of a phone in this shop is \(\)420
This price increases by \(12\%
Calculate the new price
The grid shows a trapezium
On the grid, draw an enlargement of the trapezium with scale factor 3
Write down the coordinates of point \(P\)
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps
The diagram shows four triangles, \(A, B, C\) and \(T,\) and a point \(P\) on a grid
Write down the value of the 8 in the number 39 829
Write down all the factors of 18
Show that 57 is not a prime number
Find the value of \(x\)
Find the first multiple of 40 that is greater than 620
Find the reciprocal of \(\frac{2}{3}\)
Find a fraction between \(\frac{1}{5}\) and \(\frac{1}{4}\)
Find the highest common factor (HCF) of 72 and 180
Write down an irrational number with a value between 9 and 10
Measure angle \(k\)
Write down the mathematical name for this type of angle
The diagram shows a pair of parallel lines and a straight line
Angles \(a, b, c, d\) and \(x\) are labelled
Complete the statements
Angle .................... is alternate to angle \(x\)
Angle .................... is corresponding to angle \(x\)
The diagram shows a parallelogram
Find the value of \(y\)
\(A, B\) and \(C\) lie on a circle, centre \(O\)
Find angle \(ACB\)
The interior angle of a regular polygon is \(171^{\circ}\)
Work out the number of sides of this polygon
Calculate the value of \(x\)
In a sport, teams are given points using the formula
number of points = number of wins \(\times\) 4 + number of draws \(\times\) 2 + bonus points
One team has 15 wins, 7 draws and 6 bonus points
Calculate the total number of points for this team
Solve
Solve
Expand and simplify
Make \(r\) the subject of this formula
Bo has a green bag and a blue bag
Each bag contains some marbles
The green bag has \(x\) marbles
There are 5 times as many marbles in the blue bag than in the green bag
Bo now adds 6 marbles to each bag
There are now 4 times as many marbles in the blue bag than in the green bag
Use this information to write down an equation and solve it to find the value of \(x\)
On the probability scale, draw an arrow ( \(\downarrow\) ) to show the probability that the spinner lands on the number 2
Find the probability that the spinner lands on a prime number
Find the probability that the spinner lands on the number 7
Li spins a fair 6-sided spinner numbered 1 to 6
A bag contains 3 red balls and 12 green balls
Li picks a ball at random
Find the probability that it is a green ball
Give your answer as a fraction in its simplest form
an even number
an integer
at least 10
Li spins two fair 4-sided spinners, each numbered 1 to 4
The two numbers are multiplied to give the score
Find the probability that the score is
Complete the tree diagram
Work out the probability that both of the discs she picks are blue
A bag contains red discs and blue discs
The probability that a disc picked at random is red is \(\frac{1}{5}\)
Li picks a disc at random, notes its colour and then replaces it in the bag. She then picks another disc at random
Find the area of this trapezium
The area of this triangle is \(15.3 \mathrm{cm}^2\)
Find the value of \(b\)
A circle has a circumference of \(58.6\mathrm{cm}\)
Find the radius of this circle
The diagram shows a rectangle with two semicircles removed
Calculate the shaded area
Line \(L\) has a gradient of 4 and passes through the point (0, 3)
Write down the equation of line \(L\) in the form \(y = mx + c\)
Line \(G\) has the equation \(y = 2 - 6x\)
Line \(G\) passes through the point \((a, 5)\)
Find the value of \(a\)
Complete the table of values for \(y = x^{2} - 6\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = x^{2} - 6\) for \(-4 \leqslant x \leqslant 4\)
Write down the equation of the line of symmetry of the graph
Use your graph to solve the equation \(x^{2} - 6 = 0\) for \(x > 0\)
